zone.line: "We reached the port — alas! From many spirits
The glorious hope which waked that cry was dead
Like the brief glory which dark Heaven inherits
From the false dawn, which fades ere it is spread
Upon the nights devouring darkness shed:
Yet soon bright day will burst — even like a
Of fire, to burn the shrouds outworn & dead
Which wrap the world, — a wide enthusiasm
To cleanse the fevered world as with an earthquake's
"I walked thro the great City then, but free
From shame or fears; those toil-worn mariners
And happy maiden did encompass me
And like a subterranean wind that stirs
